title: Ticket #7158: Learning from the Instructors (OSG Summer School)
description:
Lauren describes the new season of HTCondor Bugs Identified During OSG School: 

Episode 1
When your job�s executable has Windows line endings, (rather than
holding with �exec format error� as in the past,) HTCondor now tells you to
submit some other way ... which doesn�t fix the line endings and results in
an even more confusing error message.

See #7188. 

Episode 2
Did you know that self-checkpointing jobs overwrite stderr and stdout after an
eviction/rematch, rather than appending?


later clarification
If you job uses �when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT� and is evicted, the
stderr and stdout get overwritten (or re-written?). I know that some jobs using
�ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT� may not be self-checkpointing, but for jobs that ARE, it�s
kind of absurd that stderr/stdout aren�t appended.

See #7189. 

Episode 3
HTCondor tells you you�re �rejected� if it�s still setting up your interactive
job.  (Could it, rather, say something like �setting up your job environment� ?)

See #7190.

And asks about the following: "By the user?" 

Episode4.log
009 (251059.002.000) 07/16 12:37:35 Job was aborted by the user.
        Job removed by SYSTEM_PERIODIC_REMOVE due to more than 10 restarts

See #7191.
remarks:

2020-Jul-13 13:07:07 by blin:
Todd, it looks like all the listed issues have been addressed. Can we close this ticket?

Now we can.
